title: Negligent Operator
text: Your driver's license can be suspended if you accumulate too many points on your driving record within a certain period.

title: DUI Suspension
text: A DUI conviction will result in a mandatory driver's license suspension.

question: How many points does it take to suspend my license?
answer: In California, accumulating 4 points within 12 months, 6 points within 24 months, or 8 points within 36 months will result in a license suspension.

question: How can I get my license back after it's suspended?
answer: The process for getting your license back after a suspension varies depending on the reason for the suspension. You may need to complete a DUI program, pay reinstatement fees, and pass a driving test.

question: My license was suspended. Can I still drive?
